This structure allows information to be repeated through the parent child relations created by IBM and was implemented mainly in their Information Management System.

A data structure diagram is a diagram and data model used to describe conceptual data models by providing graphical notations which document entities and their relationships, and the constraints that bind them.

Relationship   The logical association among entities is called relationship  Relationships are mapped with entities in various ways  Mapping cardinalities define the number of association between two entities  Mapping cardinalities   one to one one to many many to one many to many.

Although the focus of this article is data modeling, there are often alternatives to data_oriented artifacts .

ER diagrams are visual tools that are used in the Entity_Relationship model initially proposed by Peter Chen in 1976 to create a uniform convention that considers both relational database and network views.

There are many types of keys, however, quite possibly the two most important are the primary key and the foreign key.
A database model shows the logical structure of a database, including the relationships and constraints that determine how data can be stored and accessed.
A relational database allows the definition of data structures, storage and retrieval operations and integrity constraints.
Because of the limitations of flat databases, they are not unsuitable for most software applications in which there is a need to represent and store complex business relationships.
Flat databases are also sometimes referred to as flat_file databases.
